a8a68.textContent:
In most patients, E2 subunit seems 
responsible for "classic metabolic" 
presentation of disease.

comments.content: AKA LDH-4 lactate dehydrogenase 4 (1H3M); expressed in kidneys, placenta, pancreas.
AKA LDH-1 lactate dehydrogenase 1, 4H; expressed in heart, red blood cells (RBC), brain)

b8036.textContent:
Encephalopathic form is related 
to E2 subunit deficiency.

comments.content: AKA LDH-3 lactate dehydrogenase 3 (2H2M); expressed in lungs
"[...]In most patient, the E2 subunit could be responsible for the "classic metabolic" presentation of 2-oxoglutaric aciduria" [Chapter 20, book of Blau]

Clinically recognisable form of:
deafness, onycho-osteodystrophy,
thumbs and sensorineural deafness,
is related to defect of E1 subunit.

Encephalopathic form is related 
to E2 subunit deficiency

eb160.textContent:
Clinically recognizable form of:
deafness, onycho-osteodystrophy,
thumbs and sensorineural deafness,
is related to defect of E1 subunit.

eb7d9.textContent:
Complex formation of 
SCS with NDPK 
is inprotant for 
deoxyribonucleotide salvation, 
which is needed for mtDNA 
synthesis and integrity.

comments.content: Not in original drawing, adapted from https://www.wikipathways.org/index.php/Pathway:WP78
Not in original drawing, adapted from https://www.wikipathways.org/index.php/Pathway:WP78
AKA LDH-2 lactate dehydrogenase 2 (3H1M); expressed in reticuloendohelial system
AKA lactate dehydrogenase C; expressed in testes.
AKA LDH-5 lactate dehydrogenase 5 (4M); expressed in liver, striated muscle, brain.

"Homodimer. The 2-oxoglutarate dehydrogenase (ODH) complex contains multiple copies of three enzymatic components: 2-oxoglutarate dehydrogenase (E1), dihydrolipoamide succinyltransferase (E2) and lipoamide dehydrogenase (E3) (By similarity)." [https://www.uniprot.org/uniprot/Q1B4V6]

pathway.author: [Richard97, Egonw, DeSl, IreneHemel, Josienlandman, MaintBot, Eweitz, Finterly, Fehrhart]

comments.content:
This pathway shows an simplified version of the Krebs cycle (for more details see [https://www.wikipathways.org/index.php/Pathway:WP78] ), with 4 genetic diseases related to it.
For succinyl-CoA synthetase deficiencies, relevant metabolic markers are depicted in light green.
Patients with a mutation in the SUCLG1 might present a severe (fatal) form of mitochondrial encephalomyopathy.

This pathway was inspired by Chapter 20 of the book of Blau (ISBN 3642403360 (978-3642403361)).

pathway.name: Krebs cycle disorders
